page.title: 02Woodford Rose Queen Gala
page.content: Woodford Rose Queen Gala is held once a year,in June.It is run voluntarily and the people who volunteer hold the office for two years and then the job is taken by someone else. It all starts earlier in the year when leaflets are sent all around Woodford and part of Bramhall.The leaflet enables you to say whether you want your child to take part and what you would like them to do e.g.be The Bride,The Rosebud Queen,The Rose Queen or be in the fancy dress parade.Girls have to be over 12 to be The Rose Queen and under 8 to be The Bride or The Rosebud Queen.Children under 3 cannot take part.The names of those girls who wish to take part are put into a hat and then drawn out.The Queens both have a retinue of petal throwers and The Bride has a retinue set out like a proper village wedding.
